page.title: 09Sharlston Vicar
page.content: Rev. Ford, who is 65, has been vicar in Sharlston for 7 years. He is going to move, however, to another parish. He is also vicar of Wragby. Sharlston parish stretches from Foulby to Old Snydale and Streethouse to West Lane. He estimates 4,500 are in the area of which 60 - 70 regularly attend Church. A typical day will start at 8.00 a.m. with morning prayers after which he sorts out his mail, visits people, conducts funerals and has interviews for baptisms and marriages. Evening prayers follow at 6.30 p.m. Attendance at Church is going up and seems likely to increase further. Church funds come from offerings, fees from funerals, weddings and efforts such as bazaars. Rev. Ford's replacement at Sharlston will be appointed by the Bishop and at Wragby by Lord St. Oswald.
